title: Can You See Who Viewed Your Instagram Story After 24 Hours?

steps.title: Open the Instagram app on your smartphone.
steps.content: Open the Instagram app on your smartphone. It’s the purple, pink, and orange icon with a white camera inside that you'll find on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching. [3] X Research source Login with your account, if you haven't already done so. Also, make sure that the archiving feature is not disabled on your account.

steps.title: Go to your profile page.
steps.content: Go to your profile page. Tap on your profile icon at the bottom-right corner of the app.

steps.title: Tap on the ≡ button.
steps.content: Tap on the ≡ button. This will be located at the top-right corner of your screen. The menu tab will show up, after doing so.

steps.title: Tap on the Archive option.
steps.content: Tap on the Archive option. It will be the second option on the list. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Navigate to the “Stories archive” section.
steps.content: Navigate to the “Stories archive” section. Tap on the Posts archive option at the top then select “Stories archive” .

steps.title: Select a story from there.
steps.content: Select a story from there. Remember that you can only see the viewer info up to 48 hours after you post it.

steps.title: Swipe up on the story.
steps.content: Swipe up on the story. Now you can see the number and the usernames of the people who have viewed your story. That's all!
